result.execSummary:
The defendant Kiheem A Harden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
02-03-2016/ Judge William S Pocan
The Court ordered Judgments vacated and Probation extended to 11-07-2016.
**  **  **  


Court ordered restitution in the amount of $810.00, owed to Johnnie B., and payable as a condition of Probation.
Failure to pay results in a civil judgment.

Pay all costs and surcharges within the term of Probation.
Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court waived the mandatory DNA surcharge, as this case is a misdemeanor and no DNA sample will be taken
Obtain and maintain full-time employment; may be part-time if enrolled in school part-time; not required at all if enrolled in school full-time.

NO CONTACT with Johnnie B.
NO CONTACT with drug community.
NO illegal drugs.
NO controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence, defendant may apply for expungement.  Must provide letter from agent.

Cognitive Behavior therapy.
Mental Health assessment and comply with any treatment deem necessary by the department.

AODA assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ Random urine screens.  NO positive results.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Kiheem A Harden in court with attorney Richard J. Carpenter.  Tyrone Martin St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    

Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Court ordered restitution in the amount of $810.00, owed to Johnnie B., and payable as a condition of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
    
Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9
months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 83
days time served, Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment.  Court recommends release to the Day Reporting Center and electronic monitoring.  The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 1
year with the following conditions:
*
*Alcohol and drug assessment and mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.  May be part time if enrolled in school part time.  Not required at all if enrolled in school full time.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
*Pay restitution as ordered above.
*No contact with Johnnie B.


- Pay all costs and surcharges within term of probation, or if not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.  Court WAIVED the mandatory DNA surcharge, as this case is a misdemeanor and no DNA sample will be taken.  

Appeal rights given.  Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence, defendant may apply for expungement.  Must provide letter from agent.  

**Court denied defense request for early termination of probation.

Defendant Kiheem A Harden in court with attorney Richard J. Carpenter.  Tyrone Martin St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court in trial this date; defendant requesting additional time to pay restitution.  No objection by state.  Case adjourned.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 11-07-2014 at 08:30 am.
Violation Report received and filed with court.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 1:  Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Court granted defendant time to make restitution.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing.  All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2014, this case will be assigned to:  Judge POCAN, Branch 26, in ROOM 634 of the COURTHOUSE.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 09-23-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kiheem A Harden in court with attorney Richard J. Carpenter.  Tyrone Martin St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Amended Information filed charging:  THEFT (VALUE NOT EXCEEDING $2,500), contrary to Wis. Stats. sec(s) 943.20(1)(a) & (3)(a), 939.51(3)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.
Justice Point Violation Report received and filed.  kmw

Attorney Richard J Carpenter in court, defendant Kiheem A Harden not in court, in custody.  Tyrone M St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury trial scheduled for July 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Richard J Carpenter in court, defendant Kiheem A Harden not in court, in custody.  Lucy J Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Richard J. Carpenter in court, defendant Kiheem A Harden not in court, in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Richard J. Carpenter in court, defendant Kiheem A Harden not in court, in custody.  Lucy J. Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Richard J. Carpenter in court, defendant Kiheem A Harden not in court, in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kiheem A Harden in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Defendant Kiheem A Harden in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Johnnie B or ANY scrap yard in the City of Milwaukee

Defendant Kiheem A Harden in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Defendant Kiheem A Harden in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 27, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
